intro: Cacalia clivorum, commonly known as the alpine bellflower, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Europe. It belongs to the family Campanulaceae and is characterized by its bell-shaped, blue or purple flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or alpine habitats, thriving in well-drained soils. It has slender stems and small, heart-shaped leaves. Cacalia clivorum is often found in meadows and slopes at high altitudes, where it contributes to the biodiversity of its ecosystem.
